content.rendered:
Margery Herinirina, Director

herinirinam@sid.adventist.org

Adventist Children’s Ministries is about developing the faith of children ages birth to fourteen. While Sabbath School provides for religious education once a week, Children’s Ministries looks at the whole child and seeks to provide multiple ministries that will lead children to Jesus and disciple them in their daily walk with Him. The mission of the Children’s Ministries Department is to nurture children into a loving, serving relationship with Jesus. And that every child in the world will be invited to know Jesus Christ and accept Him as his/her personal Friend and Savior.

Faith Finders

Publications, media, and ideas for those leading out in ministry to children
Click Here

Let's talk about Coronavirus!

  • English
  • French
  • Portuguese
  • How to engage and connect with kids
  • Talking to Kids About the Coronavirus
